item.title: Introduction to Data Vizualisation
item.description: Reproducible Analysis Typical data analysis workflow looks like this: collect data put it in a file or spreadsheet or database run some analyses, written in various scripts, perhaps saving some intermediate results along the way or maybe always working on the raw data. create some plots or tables of relevant summaries of the data, and then go and write a report about the results in a text editor or word processor.

item.title: Introduction to Data Vizualisation
item.description: https://www.statisticshowto.com/misleading-graphs/ > References Huff, D. (1993). How to Lie With Statistics. W. W. Norton & Company Gonick, L. (1993). The Cartoon Guide to Statistics. HarperPerennial. CITE THIS AS: > Stephanie Glen. “Misleading Graphs: Real Life Examples” From StatisticsHowTo.com: Elementary Statistics for the rest of us! https://www.statisticshowto.com/misleading-graphs/ https://github.com/stoltzmaniac/Data-Visualization-Lesson/blob/master/Data%20Visualization%20-%20Part%203.Rmd https://mschermann.github.io/data_viz_reader/ https://aims.gitbook.io/farm-data-mooc/unit-3-using-data/lesson-3.3-data-analysis-and-visualization Grammar of Graphics ggplot2() Grammar of ggplot2() Start example df <- data.frame(x=1:15, y=1:15) ggplot(df, aes(x,y)) + geom_point() + labs( title= "Plot example", subtitle = "Subtitled", x="x-values", y = "y-values" ) + theme(panel.

item.title: Introduction to Discret Choice Lesson
item.description: Introduction These Introduction slides present: Table of contents Introduction Program Motivations Importance of DCM Course Objectives General Context of Choice analysis Four broad frameworks Sample and Measurement Issues in Model Building R and Tests for Categorical Data Inference for a (Single) Proportion Two-Way Contingency Tables The Odds-Ratio Chi-Squared Tests of Independence Program 5 steps/lessons : • Introduction • Binary Choice • Multinomial Choices • Advanced Models : papers presentation (with application) • Discussion : papers discussion (reversed class) • Guided work sessions

item.title: Introduction to GIS - Geographic Information System
item.description: A FINIR Introduction Visualisation of geographic information is become one of the major tool of the digital information analytic. Numerous softwares manage visualization of geographic information from full-scale GIS applications such as ArcGIS and QGIS to web-based tools like Google maps to any number of programing languages. Using a command-line interface has the benefits of enabling both steps analysis and visualization in customizable, transparent and reproducible manner. The goal of this post is to introduce the basic landscape of working with spatial data in R from the perspective of a non-specialist.

item.title: Introduction to Survival Analysis
item.description: A FINIR Exercise - Unemployment duration Survival analysis models covariates that influence time-to-event. OLS regression methods are less efficient because the time-to-event is typically not normally distributed (positive, skewed, nearly discret when rounding are present), and the model cannot handle censored observation, without modification. library(Ecdat) ## Warning: le package 'Ecdat' a été compilé avec la version R 3.6.3 ## Le chargement a nécessité le package : Ecfun ## Warning: le package 'Ecfun' a été compilé avec la version R 3.

item.title: Introduction to Survival Analysis
item.description: A FINIR Introduction corresponds to a set of statistical approaches used to investigate the of interest to occur. Medecine, sociology, economy informatics, engineering,… In basic categorical data analysis for example, we compare proportions (risks, rates, etc) between different groups. Such analysis is performed using a chi-square or fisher exact test, or logistic regression. We implicitly assume that the rates are constant over the period of the study, and are defined by the different groups studied.
